intro: Hieracium brachycranum, commonly known as the short-crowned hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium brachycranum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
